News:: Farmar had 16 points on 5-of-10 shooting, including three 3-pointers, in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks. He added three assists, two rebounds and a steal.

News:: Coach Avery Johnson said he is going to speak with Favors about the rookie's energy level over the past few games, the Bergen Record reports.
Spin:: Favors even acknowledged that he's not playing well, saying that Johnson has given him "a wake-up call that I need to play harder." The rookie is the youngest player in the NBA, so there are bound to be some ups and downs, but Favors clearly needs to start playing with more urgency and cut down on his foolish fouls. He's not worth starting in most leagues unless his playing time increases.

News:: Harris was just 2-for-8 from the field, but went 13-for-16 from the free-throw line to finish with 18 points in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks. He added 13 assists and three steals.
Spin:: Harris is still working his way back from a knee injury, but he did a terrific job of getting to the stripe Tuesday night. He'll start hitting his shots eventually.
Status Alert: Harris has left knee strain and will miss next two games, the New York...

News:: Humphries had eight points (3-7 FG, 2-2 FT), seven rebounds and five assists in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.
Spin:: Humphries' scoring numbers have started to trail off recently, but he remains strong on the glass, hauling in an average of 7.8 boards per game. As long as he continues to get minutes, he'll be useful in that category.

News:: Lopez had 24 points (8-16 FG, 8-11 FT), five rebounds and a steal in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.
Spin:: Offensively, Lopez bounced back quickly from a miserable five-point effort against the Celtics on Sunday, though his rebounding numbers continue to be a disappointment. He might catch a break Thursday if Dallas center Tyson Chandler, who missed Tuesday's game because of a stomach illness, sits out another game.

News:: Murphy did not play in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.
Spin:: He's healthy as far as we know, so his frosty relationship with coach Avery Johnson seems like the most likely culprit for Tuesday's disappearance. Murphy has strong potential if Johnson ever decides to let him loose, but at this point a trade out of New Jersey would probably be the ideal situation for Murphy owners. He's too risky to rely on in most leagues right now.

News:: Williams did not play in Tuesday's loss to the Hawks.
Spin:: After shredding the D-League apart for three games, Williams got the call back to New Jersey on Tuesday only to find himself on the inactive list. If given the minutes, he can clearly be a fantasy factor, but that's no guarantee right now. If you have the roster room, the best strategy is to stick him on the bench and hope that he eventually sees the light of day.

News:: Chandler had 21 points (7-12 FG, 2-6 3Pt, 5-6 FT), five assists, four rebounds, two steals and a block in Monday's win over the Timberwolves.
Spin:: Chandler remained in the starting lineup despite the return of Ronny Turiaf, and coach Mike D'Antoni said after the game that he will be sticking with the same starting lineup that has produced five straight wins, the Bergen Record reports. Don't let Turiaf's return dissuade you from starting Chandler in nearly all leagues.

News:: Douglas had 11 points and six rebounds in 21 minutes off the bench in Monday's win over the Timberwolves.
Spin:: Douglas finally showed some signs of life after averaging just 3.8 points over his last five games. Perhaps he's getting closer to 100 percent after being bothered by a quad injury last week.

News:: Felton scored 18 points and handed out 11 assists during the Knicks' win Monday.
Spin:: Felton went 6-of-13 from the floor, including 5-of-8 from downtown, also recording four steals in 38 minutes of action. He's in the midst of a career-year and shows no signs of slowing down anytime soon.

News:: Fields had 15 points (two three-pointers), 10 rebounds, three assists and three steals in Sunday's win over the Raptors.
Spin:: Fields is showing no signs of slowing down after claiming Eastern Conference rookie of the month honors in November. He already has six double-doubles this season.

News:: Gallinari had 17 points (6-11 FG, 2-5 3Pt, 3-4 FT), two rebounds and an assist in Monday's win over the Timberwolves.
Spin:: The Knicks are on a five-game roll right now, and Gallinari's sharp-shooting has been a major factor. He has knocked down 13 threes during the team's five-game winning streak.

News:: Stoudemire erupted for 34 points on 15-of-23 shooting during the Knicks' win over the Timberwolves on Monday.
Spin:: Stoudemire grabbed just five boards but went 4-of-5 from the line and also added two steals and two blocks. He's playing as well as any point during his career, helping New York win five straight.

News:: Turiaf returned Monday against the Timberwolves after missing the previous four games because of left knee problems. He played 12 minutes, registering four points, three assists and a block.
Spin:: After the game, coach Mike D'Antoni told the Bergen Record that Turiaf will remain in a bench role while the Knicks stick with the starting lineup that has produced five straight wins. Turiaf's value remains limited to a cheap source of blocks and rebounds in deep leagues.

News:: Walker has a knee injury and will not play Monday against the Timberwolves, NBA.com's Adam Zagoria reports.
Spin:: Walker is averaging just 13.3 minutes this season and isn't a fantasy consideration in most leagues. Consider him day-to-day until we know more about the severity of this injury.
Status Alert: Walker has a knee injury and will not play Monday against the...

News:: Williams had 13 points, including three 3-pointers, in Monday's win over the Timberwolves. He added two rebounds, two blocks and an assist.
Spin:: Williams has now played 20-plus minutes in three straight games and is averaging 13.3 points, 3.3 three-pointers and 1.0 blocks during that span. We're not sure how long the Knicks plan to keep giving him this type of run, but if you're desperate for some long-range shooting, he has some value right now.

News:: Brackins had 30 points (13-24 FG, 1-2 3Pt, 3-4 FT), 10 rebounds, an assist, and a block in 37 minutes for the D-League's Springfield Armor Sunday.
Spin:: Brackins has double-doubled in his last two games, and he's playing significant minutes for the Armor. If he's able to show that he can rebound consistently from the power forward position, he could earn extra run for the Sixers whenever they decide to call him back up.

News:: Brand had a team-high 18 points on 7-of-10 shooting in Tuesday's win over Portland. He added three assists, two rebounds, two steals and a block.
Spin:: Despite the quiet night on the glass, Brand's bounce-back season continues, as his numbers have improved in virtually every major category.

News:: Hawes had 10 points (including a three-pointer), 12 rebounds, three blocks, an assist and a steal in Tuesday's win over the Cavaliers.
Spin:: Don't look now, but Hawes is starting to get more playing time and is averaging 8.8 points, 8.3 rebounds and 1.3 blocks over his last four games, numbers that at least make him worth a look in deeper formats.

News:: Holiday had 16 points (5-14 FG, 0-4 3Pt, 6-6 FT), seven assists, five rebounds and a steal in Tuesday's win over the Cavaliers.
Spin:: His scoring has been somewhat hit-or-miss lately, but his assist numbers have been fairly consistent and he's averaging a three-pointer and more than a steal per game.

News:: Despite shooting just 3-for-12 from the field, Iguodala finished with 13 points, seven assists, six rebounds, two steals and a block in Tuesday's win over the Cavs.
Spin:: Iguodala is barely shooting 40 percent over his last five games, and his shooting woes are part of the reason why his scoring is down a bit this season, but he does enough in the other categories to make up for it. We imagine he'll find his shooting stroke before long.

News:: Kapono (personal) practiced with the Sixers' on Monday, the Sixers' official site reports.
Spin:: Kapono missed the Sixers' last four games due to personal reasons. Though he started the year as the team's starter at small forward, Kapono's role quickly diminished. Even without family issues taking him away from the court, Kapono would be a candidate to be inactive for the Sixers. He won't have much fantasy value unless he starts playing about 25 minutes a night and burying three-pointers at a good clip.

News:: Making his second-career start Saturday, Meeks hit a career-high seven three-pointers en route to career-high 26 points versus Charlotte.
Spin:: That's a lot of career-highs, huh? Meeks displaced Evan Turner in the starting lineup Friday and certainly strengthened his case with the performance. Fantasy owners will note, however, that Meeks contributed precious little in other categories. He's worth a look, certainly, but he's not a fantasy cure-all.

News:: Nocioni was in the running to enter the Sixers' starting lineup for Friday's game against the Hawks, but he ended up receiving a DNP-CD.
Spin:: Evan Turner was moved to a bench role, and Jodie Meeks started at shooting guard. As strange as it may seem, Nocioni's benching was likely just an oversight due to match-ups against the Hawks. He should continue to come off the bench and play a decent number of minutes going forward, but if the Sixers continue to look towards evaluating their young talent, there is the possibility that Nocioni could find himself sitting a lot of nights. It's a situation that bears watching in deep leagues.

News:: Turner's second consecutive night as a reserve wasn't so great, as the swingman went scored zero points in 11 minutes Saturday versus Charlotte.
Spin:: Meanwhile, his replacement, Jodie Meeks, went off for a career-high 26 points. Turner's certainly talented, he won't be providing much value in the next couple weeks.

News:: Young had 26 points on nearly perfect 11-for-12 shooting in Tuesday's win over the Cavaliers. He added 11 rebounds and two steals.
Spin:: Cleveland was powerless to stop anything Philly was doing offensively, allowing the Sixers to shoot 52 percent from the field on their way to 117 points. Young is highly erratic (his back-to-back 20-point efforts were preceded by two single-digit clunkers), but he can fill it up if you start him on the right nights.

News:: Barbosa played 31 minutes off the bench in Monday's loss to the Pacers, finishing with 12 points (5-14 FG, 2-5 3Pt), six rebounds and three assists.
Spin:: Barbosa got back on track after a brutal performance Sunday. If you're looking for points and threes in a deep league, Barbosa can be valuable, but the glut of able bodies at the wing positions in Toronto will continue to limit his value.

News:: Bargnani led the Raptors with 26 points and 12 rebounds in a 111-99 win over the Thunder Friday.
Spin:: He continues to blossom now that he's out of Chris Bosh's shadow, maintaining his scoring average north of 20 points a game and now teasing that he might be developing some consistent rebounding skills as well, with 8.8 RPG over his last four games.

News:: Bayless had five points on 2-of-10 shooting in Monday's loss to the Pacers. He added four rebounds, two assists and a steal.
Spin:: Bayless played just 18 minutes in the blowout loss and watched Jose Calderon pour in 21 points, so perhaps speculation that he would be moving into a true time-share with Calderon was a bit overblown. He's still worth keeping an eye on in deeper leagues, but temper your expectations.

News:: Calderon had a team-high 21 points on 8-of-12 shooting, including two three-pointers, in Monday's loss to the Pacers. He added four assists and a steal.
Spin:: Calderon was physically ill before Sunday's game, but he looked much healthier on Monday and was one of few Raptors to be productive in a losing effort. He's averaging more than 10 points and eight assists since taking over as the starter.

News:: Davis had six points, eight rebounds and a steal in 23 minutes off the bench Sunday against the Knicks.
Spin:: Davis has looked impressive in the first three games of his career, averaging 7.7 points and 6.0 rebounds. Unfortunately for him, Amir Johnson is playing well too, limiting Davis to fewer than 20 minutes per game. Unless his playing time increases significantly, Davis is only worth owning in very deep leagues right now, but his strong play gives us reason to believe he'll be a productive fantasy player when his time comes.

News:: DeRozan scored 20 points with six rebounds and three assists in just 28 minutes of court time Wednesday.
Spin:: The Toronto Sun reports that DeRozan has been slowed down the last few games by a hamstring pull that he suffered 10 days ago against Boston, but he looked 100% in Wednesday's win.

News:: Dorsey played over 18 minutes off the bench Wednesday, scoring five points with eight rebounds (including five offensive boards) and three steals.

Dorsey's effort on the boards and on defense should ensure he gets his share of minutes, however.

News:: Evans underwent surgery on his right foot Wednesday and is expected to be out about eight weeks, the Toronto Sun reports.

News:: Kleiza was scoreless in just 10 minutes of playing time Sunday against the Knicks.

Curry added six assists, two steals, one blocked shot, one rebound and five turnovers in the loss.

With Lee's return, Gadzuric will get sporadic minutes wherever needed and will occasionally contribute in some meaningful way.

News:: Lee finished Tuesday's loss with 20 points, eight rebounds, seven assists and a steal.

News:: Udoh said his wrist his almost healed to the point where he can play in games, but he needs to learn the Warriors' plays and defensive schemes, the San Francisco Chronicle reports. Spin:: The Warriors are not putting an estimated date of return for Udoh, who also needs to build up strength to handle the rigors of NBA life in the paint. It appears that once the wrist is fully healed, he understands the playbook and his strength is rebuilt, Udoh should be able to contribute off the bench for Golden State immediately.

News:: Wright will have his strained lower back re-evaluated before the Warriors head out on the road Sunday, the San Jose Mercury News reports.
Spin:: Wright was at practice Wednesday, but didn't participate. He'll miss his seventh straight game Thursday because of the back. There's still no timetable for a return, but perhaps we'll get more information pending this weekend's evaluation.

News:: Wright scored 17 points and pulled down 11 rebounds during the Warriors' loss to the Mavs on Tuesday.
Spin:: Wright went 7-of-16 from the floor, also adding three 3-pointers, four assists, three steals and a block in a stat-stuffing performance. It was his third straight double-double, as he's been one of the biggest bargains in fantasy leagues this year.

News:: Aminu had 12 points and three rebounds in Sunday's loss to the Jazz.
Spin:: Aminu has been a surprisingly good three-point shooter (54 percent), but that's about where it ends. He needs to create more of an impact before he can be counted on.

News:: Bledsoe had no points and just two assists in Sunday's loss to the Trail Blazers.
Spin:: Bledsoe played just 23 minutes while Baron Davis played 28 off the bench and recorded 14 points and eight assists. The rookie remains the starter for now, but his value has taken a significant hit since Davis' return, and it may only be a matter of time before he finds himself back in a reserve role.

News:: Gordon led the Clippers with 29 points on 10-of-17 shooting during the team's win over the Kings on Monday.

News:: Griffin had 13 points, 11 rebounds and seven assists in Monday's victory over the Kings.
Spin:: Griffin's ninth consecutive double-double was quiet, but the two blocks were a nice addition to his usually gaudy stat line. Griffin's past five games of 23.4 points and 13 rebounds per game are enough to wash away any doubts of a drop in numbers.

News:: DeAndre Jordan had two points, 13 rebounds, three block and an assist in 34 minutes Wednesday.
Spin:: Jordan's 13 boards and three blocks looked more like the numbers expected from a starting NBA center. Unfortunately, he also continued his putrid free-throw shooting with an 0-for-4 performance bringing his average to 41-percent. He's limited, real limited.

News:: Kaman's (ankle) MRI revealed a deep bone bruise, Lisa Dillman of the Los Angeles Times reports.
Spin:: Kaman could be out for a while again. He could be weeks away from being 100 percent and it would be wise to look to wire for a suitable replacement.

News:: Bynum (knee) hopes to return Dec. 14 against the Wizards.
Spin:: Bynum's rehab has ramped up recently, but this is the first time he has targeted a specific game. He was originally expected to make a return near the end of the Lakers' upcoming six-game road trip, but a return on Dec. 14 would actually be the night before the team hits the road. Weekly leagues will have a tough decision when setting their lineups for the next period.

News:: Ebanks (stomach flu) returned to practice Monday and will be available for Tuesday's game against Memphis, Lakers.com reports.
Spin:: Ebanks is buried on the depth chart, so you won't need him for fantasy purposes, but he will be available Tuesday.

News:: Gasol finished Tuesday's win over the Wizards with 21 points, 14 rebounds and eight assists.
Spin:: Gasol went 7-of-18 from the field and 7-of-8 from the free-throw line in 43 minutes of playing time. He also added a steal and five blocks, as he's simply been one of the best fantasy players all season long. Even though Andrew Bynum is going to return, don't expect Gasol's production to decline much moving forward.

News:: Odom had 25 points, 11 rebounds, two blocks, two assists and a steal in Wedneday's loss to the Rockets.
Spin:: Odom's strong night came on 11-of-16 shooting, including 2-of-4 from three-point range. His production will probably take a slight hit when Andrew Bynum returns within the next couple of weeks, but Odom has been a steady force for the Lakers this season and should continue to be productive.

News:: Ratliff (knee) is still about two weeks away from returning from knee surgery,  Mike Bresnahan of the LA Times reports.
Spin:: "He's moving along quickly" coach Phil Jackson said Friday, which is obviously good news. When healthy, Ratliff has some value as a shot-blocker, at least while Andrew Bynum is still out.

News:: Barron had just six points and two rebounds in Friday's win over the Pacers.
Spin:: Barron again started at power forward, but he couldn't get anything going offensively. For that matter, neither could Hakim Warrick (no points in seven minutes) or Hedo Turkoglu (six points in 19 minutes). The power forward position in Phoenix is basically a mess right now.

News:: Childress will wear a splint on his finger for approximately two more weeks, the Arizona Republic reports.
Spin:: Childress is averaging just 6.1 points and 3.6 rebounds this season, and we doubt that shedding the splint later this month will have a significant impact on his production. He's worth owning only in very deep leagues.

News:: Frye poured in 29 points on 11-of-16 shooting, including five three-pointers, in Friday's win over the Pacers. He added five rebounds, three blocks and two steals.
Spin:: Frye has been inconsistent at times this year, but he's now averaging 16.2 points over his last five games (including more than two three-pointers per game). With the power forward spot a jumbled mess right now, Frye seems like a potential candidate to slide over to the four when Robin Lopez returns from injury later this month.

News:: Hill (foot) scored 24 points on a near-perfect 9-for-11 shooting from the field and 6-for-6 from the line Thursday night.  He also added three boards and an assist in his 29 minutes of play.

News:: Nash scored 24 points and handed out 15 assists during the Suns' loss Tuesday.
Spin:: Nash went 10-of-16 from the field and 4-of-5 from the charity stripe, also recording a steal in 39 minutes of run. Even at age 36, he hasn't slowed down one bit this season.

News:: Richardson scored 21 points (7-13 FG, 4-8 3pt, 3-4 FT) and had three steals in 31 minutes in Sunday's win against Washington.
Spin:: Over his last five games, Richardson is averaging 27.0 points per game. Phoenix relies on him to fill it up, so look for him to continue his hot start to this season.

News:: Turkoglu had nine points, seven rebounds and an assist in Thursday's win over the Warriors.
Spin:: Coach Alvin Gentry started Earl Barron at power forward, bringing both Turkoglu and Hakim Warrick off the bench. This situation is pretty fluid right now, and Turkoglu is going to be a tough play in most leagues unless he starts producing more consistently.

News:: Warrick scored 18 of his 26 points (10-13 FG) in the first half in Sunday's win against Washington. He played 29 minutes off the pine and also grabbed six rebounds.
Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET
Spin:: Warrick played the majority of the minutes at power forward for Phoenix, as Earl Barron played just 17 minutes as the starter. Keep in mind that he had done next to nothing in his previous three games, so this is no guarantee that he's ready to be productive again on a regular basis. If it's enough to convince the Suns to put him back in the starting lineup, however, his value will get a boost.

News:: Casspi scored 21 points and pulled down 10 rebounds during the Kings' loss Monday.
Spin:: Caspi went 8-of-11 from the field, adding two 3-pointers and a steal in 34 minutes off the bench. The 21 points and 10 boards were both season highs.

News:: Cousins had 15 points, seven rebounds, three assists, one steal and one block during Sacramento's loss Monday.
Spin:: Cousins went 6-of-15 from the floor and 3-of-4 from the line in 29 minutes of action. He'll be worth using in fantasy leagues as long as he remains in the Kings' starting lineup.

News:: Dalembert had five points, four rebounds, two assists and a steal in Friday's loss to the Mavericks.
Spin:: Dalembert has been battling knee tendinitis but was able to play 17 minutes in the second game of a back-to-back. Unfortunately for Dalembert owners, DeMarcus Cousins racked up a double-double in 31 minutes, and in coach Paul Westphal's ever-changing lineup schemes, the rookie appears to have the upper hand right now.
Status Alert: Dalembert left Tuesday's game against the Pacers in the 4th quarter...

News:: Evans poured in 25 points on 11-of-20 shooting, including three three-pointers, in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He also chipped in eight assists, five rebounds and a steal.
Spin:: Evans is dealing with a multitude of injuries, but he looked pretty spry in his 41 minutes of court time Saturday. With the defensively-challenged Clippers and Wizards on tap next week, this could be the start of a nice offensive run for last season's Rookie of the Year.

News:: Garcia (illness) returned to action Tuesday.
Spin:: Garcia scored six points with two 3-pointers in 21 minutes off the bench.
Status Alert: Garcia (illness) will be available for Tuesday's game against Indiana,...

News:: Greene had 19 points on 8-of-15 shooting, including three three-pointers, in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added a rebound, an assist and a steal.
Spin:: Coach Paul Westphal continued to tinker with his starting lineup Saturday, but Greene remained a starter and responded with his best scoring output of the season. However, his hold on the job is still shaky (especially with Westphal at the helm), and his averages over the last five games (10.2 points, 2.8 rebounds and 1.4 three-pointers) don't exactly scream "must-start."

News:: Landry had just four points on 1-of-6 shooting in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added a steal and a block.
Spin:: Starter Jason Thompson had just four points and played only 20 minutes, but Landry couldn't do anything to capitalize on his increased playing time (28 minutes). Sacramento's starting lineup could change again at any time, but relying on Landry right now is not recommended.

News:: Thompson had just four points on 1-of-5 shooting in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added five rebounds and two blocks.
Spin:: Thompson was ineffective all night and played just 20 minutes, but backup Carl Landry didn't do much with his 28 minutes, recording just four points on 1-of-6 shooting. Thompson will likely remain the starter for now, but the Kings haven't been shy about shaking up the lineup this season, so more change could be on the horizon, especially with the team currently on a dreadful 1-13 slide.

News:: Udrih was 6-of-11 from the field and 2-of-4 from three-point range on his way to 16 points in Saturday's loss to the Mavericks. He added six assists, three rebounds and a steal.
Spin:: Although the Kings lost, Udrih's return to the starting lineup produced the kind of immediate offensive results that the team simply wasn't getting from Luther Head. You know by now that no Kings lineup is set in stone, but Udrih certainly appears to have the upper hand right now and is definitely worth investigating if he was cut loose in your league.

News:: The Kings assigned Whiteside to the D-League on Monday, the team's official site reports.
Spin:: Whiteside is a major project and had played just two minutes for the Kings this season, which wasn't doing him any good. He'll have a legitimate chance to develop in the D-League.

News:: Bogans continues to start at shooting guard for the Bulls, but his role has steadily been diminishing.
Spin:: Bogans went scoreless in 13 minutes Friday, and he's averaging just 2.4 points, 1.2 rebounds, and 1.0 assists in 15 minutes of action over his last five games. Ronnie Brewer has been stealing most of the minutes at shooting guard lately, but he's been a dud offensively as well.

News:: Boozer scored 29 points (13-of-21 FG) and grabbed 12 rebounds to help the Bulls beat the Thunder 99-90 Monday.
Spin:: He's officially back. Start him with confidence moving forward, and owners who patiently waited on Boozer will be rewarded moving forward.
Status Alert: Boozer (hand) will play in Wednesday's game against the Magic,  K.C....

News:: Brewer had eight points, 10 rebounds, three assists and a steal in Saturday's win over the Kings.
Spin:: Brewer has been getting averaging more than 26 minutes over his last seven games, so there might be some value here in very deep leagues, but we're not expecting him to produce a rebounding total like this consistently.

News:: Carlos Boozer's seemingly imminent return may reduce Deng's minutes, Chicago Breaking Sports reports.
Spin:: Deng averaged 34 minutes in 2008-09, 37.9 last year and is up to 39.7 this year. With Boozer sliding back into his power forward spot, it will allow Taj Gibson to move to the bench, where he will back up both forward spots, helping to reduce Deng's minutes. The reduction shouldn't have that much of an adverse effect on Deng's production and could make him fresher later in the season.

News:: Gibson (foot) played 23 minutes Wednesday versus Orlando in Carlos Boozer's (hand) return to action.
Spin:: It was a blowout in Orlando's favor, so the numbers are necessarily a little skewed, but something in the vicinity of 20 minutes per game sounds about right for Gibson going forward. He's probably not playable right now by most formats.
Status Alert: Gibson (foot) will be a game-time decision Wednesday, the Chicago...

News:: Noah was limited to 20 minutes due to foul trouble but contributed 12 rebounds, six assists and six points in the Bulls' 99-90 win over the Thunder on Monday.
Spin:: After his anomaly of a zero-rebound game against Orlando on Dec. 1, Noah has grabbed double-digit boards the past three games. His daily total may take a hit now that Carlos Boozer is back and close to 100 percent, but he still should be a solid source of boards and blocks.

News:: Rose did everything possible on the basketball court in the Bulls' Saturday overtime win versus Houston, scoring 30 points (13-28 FG, 4-6 3Pt) while also adding seven rebounds, 11 assists, five steals, and a block.
Spin:: Notably, tonight's performance from downtown now brings Rose's season three-point shooting average to above 33%. The addition of that skill, combined with improvement elsewhere, has made him a borderline first-round pick.

News:: Watson left the Bulls' 96-85 win over the Kings in the fourth quarter with a dislocated left finger.
Spin:: Watson, who had a big game Friday starting in place of Derrick Rose, was back in a reserve role as Rose was able to play Saturday. If Watson is forced to miss any time, John Lucas will likely see his minutes.

News:: Gibson knocked down four 3-pointers on his way to 21 points (6-for-14 FG, 5-for-7 FT) in 28 minutes on Thursday against the Heat.  He also added four boards, two assists and a steal.
Spin:: Gibson was the only Cavaliers player that seemed up to the challenge of playing well with LeBron James in the house, and he has registered 37 points with five treys in his last two games.

News:: Graham returned to the Cavaliers' lineup Sunday after missing one game because of the flu.
Spin:: Graham was in the starting lineup at small forward and had eight points, three rebounds, one assist and one blocked shot in 18 minutes in Cleveland's loss to Detroit.

News:: Hickson had 18 points, four rebounds, a block and a steal in Tuesday's loss to the 76ers.
Spin:: Nights like this make you remember the offensive potential Hickson possesses, but we're still not willing to trust him considering he scored in double figures just once in his previous 10 games. Wait for him to string a couple of these together before entrusting him with a lineup spot again.

News:: Moon was a DNP in Sunday's loss to the Pistons.
Spin:: After watching his team go through a run of particularly bad basketball, Cavaliers head coach Byron Scott told the Cleveland Plain Dealer that he's considering changes to the rotation. And it looks like cutting Moon's minutes is just one of the alterations.

News:: Sessions had 14 points on 6-of-10 shooting in Tuesday's loss to the Celtics. He added four assists and three rebounds.
Spin:: Sessions is playing between 15-20 minutes per game, and the sparse court time makes it difficult for him to provide any type of consistent production. Witness his last five point totals: 15, 3, 13, 5 and 14. That kind of fluctuation makes him tough to rely on in most standard leagues.

News:: Varejao had 16 points on 7-of-12 shooting in Tuesday's loss to the Celtics. He completed his double-double with 12 rebounds while adding three assists and two steals.
Spin:: Varejao won't get you a lot of scoring, but his blocks, rebounding and strong field-goal percentage help make up for his low-scoring nights.

News:: Williams, who started Saturday night in place of the flu-stricken Joey Graham, was back on the bench for Sunday's loss to Detroit.
Spin:: Williams had three points on 1-of-6 shooting with two rebounds, two assists and three steals in 23 minutes in Cleveland's loss to Detroit. He's been getting very little of run of late, but with the Cavaliers playing awful basketball, coach Byron Scott trotted him out there.

News:: Williams had 11 points on just 2-of-8 shooting in Thursday's loss to Miami. He added six assists and a rebound.
Spin:: The Cavs held tough early, but eventually got steamrolled by LeBron James and the Heat in James' return to Cleveland. The fact that Williams' 11 points were second on the team indicates just how much the Cavs' offense struggled.

News:: Bynum did not play in Sunday's win over Cleveland.
Spin:: This marks the second straight game in which Bynum did not get off the bench. And this, despite coach Jon Keuster going with a small lineup for much of the second half.

News:: Pistons coach John Kuester said he would like to use the three-guard lineup he deployed Sunday "a lot" going forward, the Detroit News reports.
Spin:: Kuester used a five-man unit consisting of Gordon, Rodney Stuckey, Richard Hamilton, Tayshaun Prince and Ben Wallace to open the second half against the Cavs on Sunday. The lineup juggling helped spur the Pistons to victory and should result in expanded use of that combination. Gordon has now played 30-plus minutes in back-to-back games. If that trend continues, expect added production to soon follow.

News:: Hamilton scored a team-high 27 points (10-of-17 FG, 4-of-6 3Pt, 3-of-3 FT) in Sunday's 102-92 win over Cleveland.
Spin:: Hamilton's shot was falling on Sunday and he was rewarded with over 35 minutes of playing time, just the third time this season he has eclipsed that mark. While not as prolific of a scorer as in years past, Hamilton is providing an added value this season with his new found range. The 31-year-old guard is averaging a career-high 1.2 threes per contest. As long as he keeps on hitting shots from beyond the arc, Rip will hold value in most formats.

News:: The Pistons are optimistic Jerebko could return from his Achilles injury sooner than the initial five- to six-month timetable, the Detroit Free Press reports.
Spin:: Jerebko will have his protective boot removed this weekend and start rehabbing shortly thereafter. The Pistons won't put a timetable on his return, but the hopes are if things go well, the Swede could return before his original mid-March target.

News:: Updating an earlier report, coach John Kuester has said that his starting lineup will not change ahead of Friday's game with the Magic,  Keith Langlois of NBA.com reports.
Spin:: It appears Maxiell's job is safe for now, but his hold on the starting power forward role is tenuous at best.

News:: Pistons coach John Kuester plans to deploy McGrady as the backup point guard for the time being, the Detroit Free Press reports.
Spin:: Kuester has used McGrady as the backup floor general in each of the past two games, but the veteran has averaged just 17 minutes in those two outings. While this move has done little to benefit McGrady's production, it squashes any value Will Bynum had as the team's backup point guard.

News:: Monroe had six points, two rebounds, four assists, and a steal in 27 minutes Friday.
Spin:: Monroe has averaged 26 minutes off the bench in his last three games. The Pistons have given him a larger role lately, but they've continued to lose. Their rotation is an absolute mess right now, and Monroe won't have enough value to be relevant in standard leagues until he's playing 30 minutes nightly.

News:: Prince put up 30 points (11-15 FG, 2-3 3Pt, 6-7 FT), three rebounds, and five assists in 40 minutes Friday.
Spin:: Prince is averaging 19.8 points, 4.8 rebounds, four assists, and 0.8 steals over his last five games. Only Prince and Rodney Stuckey are playing regular rotation minutes for the Pistons right now, and Prince has been making the best of his minutes lately. Make sure he isn't available in your league.

News:: Stuckey scored 24 points and dished 11 assists in 41 minutes in Sunday's win over Cleveland.
Spin:: With Will Bynum (two straight DNPs) falling out of favor with coach Jon Keuster, Stuckey is getting all the run he wants at point guard, having played a combined 76 minutes in the past two games.

News:: Villanueva (personal) will not play against Houston on Tuesday, MLive.com reports.
Spin:: Villanueva doesn't have a set return date, but there's a good chance he'll play Wednesday. He's expected to be back for Friday's game against Minnesota at the latest.

News:: Collison left Monday's game against the Raptors in the fourth quarter with an apparent leg injury, the Indianapolis Star's Mike Wells reports.
Spin:: Collison was having a strong game before the injury, scoring 17 points on 6-of-7 shooting to go along with three rebounds, an assist and a steal. No word yet on the nature or severity of the injury, but T.J. Ford could be poised to make a start or two if Collison misses some time.
Status Alert: Collison left Monday's game against the Raptors in the fourth quarter...

News:: Dunleavy scored 16 points (6-of-11 FG, 2-of-5 3pt, 2-of-2 FT) with eight rebounds and two blocks in 30 minutes off the bench in Indiana's loss to Phoenix on Friday. Brandon Rush got the start at shooting guard with coach Jim O'Brien wanting a better defender against the Suns' Jason Richardson.
Spin:: When Rush starts, Dunleavy's minutes are typically limited (21.8 mpg in four games as reserve), but that wasn't the case against the smallish Suns' lineup Friday. This makes the third time in the last four games that Dunleavy was brought off the bench. O'Brien insists both players can start or come off the bench, depending on the matchup that particular night. For fantasy players in daily leagues, look at the Pacers' opponent. If there's a scorer at shooting guard -- say, Kobe Bryant, Dwyane Wade or Jason Richardson -- O'Brien will want Rush's defense in the starting lineup. Otherwise, you can expect Dunleavy to start (32.5 mpg as a starter).

News:: Ford had 10 points and nine assists in 26 minutes off the bench Friday against Phoenix.
Spin:: Ford got some extra playing time because Darren Collison was struggling with turnovers, but we imagine that Collison will regain the upper hand in the playing time battle soon.

News:: Foster has slipped behind Solomon Jones on the Pacers' depth chart at center, the Indianapolis Star reports.
Spin:: Foster, who opened the season behind Jones and then had an ankle injury, was getting some run in mid-November before his back flared up. Jones used that opportunity to become more active on the boards and that's been working for coach Jim O'Brien. "I have a great deal of confidence with Jeff," O'Brien said. "I think Jeff's a hell of a player. We have Roy [Hibbert], who is getting 30 minutes a game. That leaves you with 18 minutes. You can't go nine (minutes) and nine (minutes). If we're only playing Roy 20 minutes a game, we can play everybody."

News:: Granger scored 21 points on 9-of-16 shooting from the field, including 2-of-5 from 3-point range, in Indiana's win over Toronto on Monday. He also had nine rebounds, five assists, one steal and one blocked shot in 31 minutes.
Spin:: Granger was coming off a couple of bad games at the end of the Pacers' road trip last week, but was able to find his stroke against the defensively challenged Raptors. The Pacers ran out to a big lead early, allowing Granger to get more rest than usual.

News:: Hansbrough's only playing time in Monday's blowout win over Toronto came in the final six-and-a-half minutes, the Indianapolis Star reports.
Spin:: Hansbrough can certainly bring some energy to the floor, but he's still learning how to play away from the basket, something coach Jim O'Brien wants in his power forwards. That's why we're seeing much of the minutes at the four going to Josh McRoberts and James Posey.

News:: Hibbert scored 13 points on 6-of-9 shooting with six rebounds, six assists and two blocks in the Pacers' win over the Raptors on Monday.
Spin:: Hibbert picked up some early fouls and was a non-factor in Indiana's loss to Phoenix on Friday.

News:: Jones has moved ahead of Jeff Foster on the Pacers' depth chart at center, the Indianapolis Star reports. "I'm just getting an opportunity and making the best of it," Jones said. "(Coach Jim O'Brien) has gotten confidence in me, and my teammates have been feeling the same. I know what to expect, so I can go out there and play without anything on my shoulders."
Spin:: Jones got off to a slow start with just four rebounds in his first 70 minutes of play. At 6-10, that wasn't cutting it. O'Brien sat him while giving his minutes to Jeff Foster, but Foster's ankle injury forced the coach to go back to Jones. Given a second chance, Jones responded. He's averaging 5.0 rebounds in 17.1 minutes per game in the last seven games.

News:: McRoberts scored 12 points (4-of-11 FG, 1-of-4 3pt, 3-of-4 FT) with seven rebounds, six assists, three blocks and two steals in 26 minutes Monday night in Indiana's win over Toronto.
Spin:: McRoberts had a prolonged stretch of games in which he was giving fantasy owners little in the way of production, but there's been a slight uptick lately. In the last seven games, he's averaging 9.9 points, 6.3 rebounds, 3.7 assists and 2.1 blocks in 25.1 minutes a night. Tyler Hansbrough is barely playing, and the power forward job is primarily McRoberts' these days.

News:: Rush scored a game-high 26 points on 10-of-18 shooting from the field, including 6-of-8 from 3-point range, in 32 minutes off the bench Indiana's win over Toronto on Monday.
Spin:: The Raptors weren't doing too much in the way of defending with Rush and his teammates getting any shot they wanted. Rush, who was back in a reserve role after starting against Phoenix on Friday, has led the Pacers in scoring in the last two games.

News:: Bogut had 11 points, 13 rebounds, three assists and three blocks during the Bucks' loss to the Heat on Monday.
Spin:: Bogut went just 4-of-12 from the field, but he only committed one turnover and continues to produce when in the lineup. He's averaging a career-best 11.5 rebounds per game this season.
Status Alert: Bogut (back) never made the trip out west to meet up with his team, and...

News:: Delfino said a recent evaluation showed him to be 90 percent free of his concussion-like symptoms, but he has to be symptom-free before he will be cleared to get back on the court, the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel reports.
Spin:: "It's frustrating because it's nothing you can control," Delfino said. "You have to be honest with yourself, continue to work and if you feel bad, just stop. If you try to overdo it will make it worse." Delfino has been lightly riding a stationary bike recently, but that's about the extent of his physical activity. He remains out indefinitely.
Status Alert: Delfino said a recent evaluation showed him to be 90 percent free of...

News:: Douglas-Roberts scored 11 points in 20 minutes during his first game of the season on Saturday.
Spin:: Douglas-Roberts was returning from an eye injury that had kept him out since the season began.  We'll have to wait and see how much time he sees after Carlos Delfino returns.

News:: Gooden (foot) didn't play Monday.
Spin:: It was the fourth missed game out of the last five contests for Gooden, who remains day-to-day with the injury.
Status Alert: Gooden (foot) will be a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against...

News:: Maggette (ankle) had 17 points, four assists and a steal in Wednesday's loss to the Nuggets.
Spin:: Maggette returned after missing two games with a sore ankle. He's only averaging 12.8 points per game this season, and because of the Bucks' glut of players on the wing, his playing time isn't likely to trend upward anytime soon unless some injuries strike.

topic_entity_name: Luc Richard Mbah a Moute  #12  SF

News:: Making another start in place of the injured Andrew Bogut, Sanders had 14 points, 10 rebounds, eight blocks and two steals in Wednesday's loss to the Nuggets.
Spin:: Sanders was outstanding in a losing effort, and he's shown flashes this season that should have the Bucks excited about his long-term potential. However, Bogut will be back before long, so there's not much short-term fantasy value to be had here.

News:: The Bucks signed Skinnner on Thursday, the team's official site reports.
Spin:: Skinner will add depth to the Bucks' frontcourt, but he shouldn't have much of a role in the rotation.

News:: Ajinca saw his first action in 13 games, scoring three points and collecting six rebounds Tuesday.
Spin:: Ajinca was called into duty with Tyson Chandler sidelined by a stomach bug. He is not fantasy relevant.

News:: The Mavericks assigned Beaubois (foot) to the D-League on Tuesday, NBA.com's John Schuhmann reports.
Spin:: Beaubois will attend the Texas Legends' home opener but will not play. Owner Mark Cuban called it "a marketing support move for the Legends." In other words, this isn't a rehab stint for Beaubois, it's simply a marketing attempt to boost D-League ticket sales. Beaubois remains at least three weeks away from returning.

News:: Butler scored 13 points on 4-of-10 shooting Saturday. He added five rebounds and a steal.
Spin:: Butler played 26 minutes as he continues to split time with Shawn Marion. He is averaging a career-low 29.8 minutes per game.

Next Game:: Warriors at MavericksTuesday 12/7, 8:30 PM ET NBAt

News:: Chandler (illness) is inactive for Tuesday's game against the Warriors, Mavs.com's Earl K. Sneed reports.
Spin:: The league-wide stomach virus strikes again. Brendan Haywood will start in Chandler's place Tuesday, and since most players hit with the virus have been missing a few days, Chandler should be considered questionable for Thursday's game against the Nets.
Status Alert: Chandler (illness) is inactive for Tuesday's game against the Warriors,...

News:: Haywood scored nine points and blocked three shots on Saturday as Dallas won their ninth consecutive game.
Next Game:: Warriors at MavericksTuesday 12/7, 8:30 PM ET NBAt
Spin:: Haywood has been more active since serving a team-mandated one-game suspension. However, his numbers continue to be too inconsistent to warrant a fantasy roster spot.

News:: Jones will join the Dallas D-League affiliate, the Texas Legends, on Tuesday, ESPN Dallas reports.
Next Game:: Warriors at MavericksTuesday 12/7, 8:30 PM ET NBAt
Spin:: Jones had not seen the court in seven games before playing eight minutes Monday. He finished with two points and three turnovers.

News:: Kidd shot an unimpressive 2-of-10 from the field, including 1-of-8 on three-pointers Saturday. He finished with eight points, five assists, and five rebounds in the win.
Spin:: Kidd has struggled with his shot recently, shooting 14-of-42 (33 percent) from the field in Dallas' last five games.

News:: Mahinmi collected the first double-double of his career Tuesday in a win over Golden State. He scored 12 points to go along with 10 rebounds.
Spin:: Mahinmi filled in admirably as Tyson Chandler was inactive with a stomach illness. Expect him to return to limited action when Chandler is healthy.

News:: Marion tallied just four points Saturday as Dallas won its ninth straight game. He did manage to grab eight rebounds and block one shot.
Spin:: Marion has not scored in double figures in Dallas' last two games after doing so in the previous five outings. Look for him to continue to share time with Caron Butler.

News:: Nowitzki scored a team-high 25 points Tuesday as Dallas pushed their winning streak to 10 games. He added four blocks and two steals.
Spin:: Another solid night for Nowitzki as the Mavericks continue to roll.

News:: Terry bounced back from an off-night shooting Friday to score 23 points in Saturday's win over the Kings. He shot 7-of-14 from the field and a perfect 7-of-7 from the line.
Spin:: The 23-point effort was the first time Terry has topped 20 points  since a November 14 win over New Orleans.

News:: Battier (illness) will be a game-time decision for Tuesday's game against Detroit, NBA.com writer Jason Friedman reports.
Spin:: If Battier is out, it'd presumably result in more work for Courtney Lee and Chase Budinger.
Status Alert: Battier (illness) will be a game-time decision for Tuesday's game...

News:: Brooks (ankle) went through an extensive shooting drill after practice with Chase Budinger on Monday and said he is still targeting Thursday for his return, though he said he has not been told if he has been cleared to practice this week, the Houston Chronicle reports. "It's getting better every day," Brooks said. "I keep working hard, have a great training staff that is very used to this injury."
Spin:: Brooks could be back later this week, but we'll have a better idea once he returns to a full practice.
Status Alert: Brooks (ankle) went through an extensive shooting drill after practice...

News:: Hill had 10 points, four rebounds, two assists and a block in 28 minutes Wednesday.
Spin:: Perhaps more importantly, Hill did a good job defensively on Pau Gasol in the second half. Hill is likely to lose minutes when Yao Ming comes back next week, but Yao's no lock to stay healthy, and Hill is the team's most athletic big man. There's a chance Hill pushes for a bigger role at some point in the season.

News:: Lowry came through with 22 points, 12 assists and six steals in Houston's win Tuesday.
Spin:: Lowry went 7-of-13 from the floor and 4-of-5 from the line, also adding four 3-pointers in yet another strong effort. He's been fantastic since joining the starting lineup, but unfortunately, his fantasy value will get killed once Aaron Brooks returns to action, which should happen relatively soon.

News:: Martin (flu) played just 28 minutes Saturday, scoring 14 points.
Spin:: Martin should see his usual 30-35 mpg once he gets well.

News:: Miller crossed the 20-point threshold for the second time in as many games, scoring 20 exactly (6-13 FG, 4-9 3Pt, 4-5 FT) while adding three assists and three blocks Saturday at Chicago.
Spin:: It's unlikely that Miller is experiencing a renaissance, but it ought to be noted that he's now 16-of-32 on three-pointers this season. Even with him playing 20-25 minutes per game, Miller's rosterable in a four-game week.

News:: Yao (ankle) did not practice Monday and will not play Tuesday, the Houston Chronicle's Jonathan Feigen reports.
Spin:: Yao may try to practice Wednesday, but there's too much uncertainty here to rely on him in weekly lineup leagues. His earliest possible return will be Friday against the Bucks.
Status Alert: Yao (ankle) did not practice Monday and will not play Tuesday, the...

News:: Scola scored 35 points and grabbed 12 rebounds during the Rockets' 97-83 win over the Pistons on Tuesday.
Spin:: Scola went 16-of-25 from the field,  also recording a block in 41 minutes of action. After opening the season with three straight double-doubles, this was just his second since then, but no one is going to complain with the way Scola has performed this year.

News:: Arthur (groin) scored seven points and grabbed four rebounds in 19 minutes against the Rockets on Friday.
Spin:: The groin malady had kept him Arthur out of the Grizzlies' two previous games, but it looks like he is ready to resume his regular standing in the rotation at around 20 minutes per game.

News:: Carroll (ankle) saw his first action in nearly a month Wednesday, the Memphis Commercial Appeal reports.
Spin:: Unfortunately, that action only lasted one minute and 57 seconds.

News:: Conley poured in 28 points on 10-of-13 shooting to help Memphis beat the Lakers on Tuesday.
Spin:: Conley added four 3-pointers, three rebounds, three assists and two steals. The 28 points were a season-high.

News:: Gay scored a team-high 24 points on 8-of-17 shooting (2-of-3 3pt) from the field and 6-of-9 from the free-throw line in Memphis' loss to Denver on Sunday.
Spin:: Gay scoring dipped a bit toward the end of November (14.8 ppg in eight games), but is averaging 25 points in three December games.

News:: Henry scored 17 points (8-12 FG, 1-2 3pt) to go with two rebounds and three assists in the Grizzlies' loss to the Nuggets on Sunday.
Spin:: The 17 points were a career best for Henry, who has averaged 7.9 points per game on 49.1 percent shooting since taking over as the team's starting shooting guard.

News:: Randolph scored 17 points and grabbed 14 rebounds during the Grizzlies' 94-85 loss to the Jazz on Monday.
Spin:: Randolph went 8-of-17 from the floor, also adding one steal and two blocks in 40 minutes of action. It was his 12th double-double of the season.

News:: Ariza scored a season-high 21 points (9-21 FG, 0-4 3Pt, 3-3 FT) to go with nine rebounds, two assists, and three steals Friday.
Spin:: Ariza benefited from playing the Knicks and the absence of David West (illness). He hadn't taken more than 15 shots in any of the team's previous 18 games. His extended role in the offense will dry up when West returns.

News:: Belinelli had two points and went 0-for-6 from the field in Sunday's blowout loss to San Antonio.
Spin:: Not good for Belinelli, whose only value to the Hornets is putting the ball through the hoop.  He doesn't get rebounds, or assists, and his defense leaves a lot to be desired.

News:: Mbenga did not travel with the Hornets for Sunday's game in San Antonio because of the flu, the Associated Press reports.
Spin:: Mbenga caught the bug that's been sweeping the NBA of late.

News:: Paul had 16 points and eight dimes, but only played 30 minutes in yet another Hornets blowout loss Sunday night.
Spin:: Paul has to be regretting the decision not to force a trade out of New Orleans over the summer at this point.  The Hornets are a mess on the court, and it's even messier off it.

News:: Smith started at power forward in place of the ill David West on Friday and put up 12 points (5-8 FG, 2-2 FT), five rebounds, and an assist in 15 minutes.
Spin:: Smith put up decent stats in limited minutes, but he isn't likely to duplicate that production most nights. West will return soon and reclaim any of the extra looks Smith received in the Hornets' offense Friday.

News:: West returned to the Hornets' lineup Sunday after missing one game because of the flu.
Spin:: West may have preferred to sit out one more game as New Orleans was pummeled by San Antonio. West scored 13 points on 6-of-11 shooting with five rebounds, three assists, one steal and one block in 30 minutes.

News:: Blair had 10 points and eight rebounds in the Spurs' win over the Hornets on Sunday.
Spin:: Blair played 29 minutes on Sunday and is averaging roughly 20 minutes per game over his last five contests.

News:: Bonner scored 14 points on 5-of-6 shooting, including four 3-pointers, in 16 minutes Sunday in San Antonio's win over New Orleans.
Spin:: Bonner had entered the game making just one of his last 10 attempts from distance. If he's not hitting threes, there's really no reason for him to be on a roster. After his 4-for-5 performance Sunday, Bonner is connecting on 50 percent of his three-point attempts.

News:: Duncan played just 19 minutes, sitting out much of the second half in Sunday's blowout win over New Orleans.
Spin:: Duncan still did some damage in his part-time job Sunday, scoring 11 points with nine rebounds and three assists. Resting Duncan in games like this a preferred ploy of coach Gregg Popovich.

News:: Ginobili had 27 points, six rebounds and five steals in the Spurs' win over the Warriors on Tuesday.
Spin:: Ginobili's big scoring came in a game in which he didn't even play the fourth quarter. Manu is averaging more than 26ppg over his last five contests, and with a date against the Clippers on Wednesday, expect that trend to continue.

News:: Hill had 20 points (7-12 FG, 1-3 3Pt, 5-7 FT), two rebounds, one assist, and a steal in 34 minutes off the bench Friday.
Spin:: Hill has scored in double-digits in seven straight games and seems to have figured out how to be consistently productive off the bench. Over his last five games, Hill is averaging 16.8 points, 2.6 rebounds, 2.2 assists, 1.0 three-pointers, and 2.0 steals in 32.2 minutes. Make sure he's owned in your league.

News:: Jefferson had 15 points and 10 rebounds in the Spurs' win over the Timberwolves on Friday.
Spin:: Jefferson is up in nearly every statistical category this year, but his 49% field goal percentage is the highest he's had in years.

News:: Neal scored eight points on 3-of-8 shooting, including 2-of-4 from three-point distance, in 21 minutes in San Antonio's win over New Orleans on Sunday.
Spin:: Neal's averaging about only 14 minutes a night, but is getting off three 3-point attempts while converting 40 percent of the time. He has some value in a head-to-head format.

News:: Parker had 19 points (7-10 FG) and six assists in the Spurs' win over the Hornets on Sunday.
Spin:: Parker's success this season has mostly to do with his increased shooting ability, as he's making more than 51 percent of his shots from the field this season.

News:: Spurs coach Gregg Popovich said Splitter's role and minutes have been hurt by him being injured for nearly all of the preseason, the Associated Press reports.
Spin:: Splitter had five points in 18 minutes in San Antonio's win over New Orleans on Sunday, which came after a five-game run in which he averaged 8.4 minutes per game. Popovich's comments imply that Splitter will gain a more consistent role as he becomes more assimilated, but that's something we're not betting on.

News:: Collins will start Monday against Orlando, the Atlanta Journal-Constitution reports.
Spin:: It looks like the Hawks are going to go with a bigger lineup, with Collins, Josh Smith and Al Horford all in the starting five. Don't worry about adding Collins until we see how this new configuration plays out.

News:: Crawford poured in 26 points (11-17 FG, 2-4 3Pt, 2-3 FT) off the bench in Tuesday's win over the Nets. He added six assists, three steals and two rebounds.
Spin:: The Hawks are now 4-1 since Joe Johnson went down with an elbow injury, and Crawford is assuming more of the offensive load, averaging nearly 17 points per game during that span.

News:: As anticipated, Evans joined the starting lineup with Joe Johnson (elbow) out. Perhaps also as anticipated, it was Jamal Crawford who benefited more directly from Johnson's absence.
Spin:: Evans played 21 minutes in a close game and without any sort of foul trouble -- all of which suggests he's not worth an add right now.

Birth Place: San Felipe de Puerto, Dominican Republic
News:: Horford had 24 points (10-18 FG, 4-5 FT), 10 rebounds and six assists in Tuesday's win over the Nets.
Spin:: The Hawks were forced to move some pieces around in their lineup when Joe Johnson went down with an elbow injury, and Horford's shift to power forward has paid immediate dividends. He's shouldering a larger offensive role and is averaging nearly 20 points per game over his last five.

News:: Johnson underwent successful arthroscopic surgery on his right elbow Thursday, the Associated Press reports.
Spin:: Johnson will be able to begin his rehab Friday. Owners will have to do without him for four-to-six weeks. Mo Evans will start in Johnson's place, but Jamal Crawford figures to see the biggest boost in production.
Status Alert: Johnson (elbow) will undergo arthroscopic elbow surgery with Dr. James...

News:: Powell had his second quality effort in three games, recording 12 points (5-10 FG, 2-2 FT) and six rebounds in 21 minutes off the bench.
Spin:: Powell appears to be playing some role in filling the vacuum left by Joe Johnson's (elbow) absence. He's not a must-have player at the moment, just someone to bump up in your mental rankings.

News:: Smith dropped 34 points on the Nets on Tuesday, shooting 14-of-16 from the field, 2-of-2 from long range and 4-of-7 from the free-throw line. He added seven assists, three rebounds, two blocks and a steal.
Spin:: They don't call Philips Arena the Highlight Factory for nothing. Smith is thriving in his new role as small forward since Joe Johnson went down to injury, scoring 53 points and pulling down 16 rebounds in his last two games.

News:: Wilkins made his debut for the Hawks on Saturday, playing, scoring zero points in 13 minutes at Miami.
Spin:: He might be in the rotation, but it's unlikely he stumbles into any sort of fantasy value -- that is, unless "Being the Nephew of an NBA Legend" is a category in your league.

News:: Williams (knee) had seven points, four rebounds and two assists in Tuesday's win over the Nets.
Spin:: Williams' knee looked fine, but he failed to score in double figures for the third straight game. Perhaps the Hawks' decision to use him as a shooting guard with Joe Johnson out is to blame. However, even at his more natural position he was a model of inconsistency, and he's still only worth owning in larger leagues until he's able to demonstrate any semblance of reliability.
Status Alert: Williams had just two points on 1-of-6 shooting in Monday's win over...

News:: Even though Augustin missed all four three-point attempts, he led the Bobcats with 26 points in Saturday's loss to the Bucks. He added six assists and three rebounds.
Spin:: Augustin has really stepped up his game as the starting point guard for the Bobcats so far this season. With the big increase in minutes-per-game from last season, Augustin is also increasing his production numbers substantially. He should even making it hard for any fantasy team owner to decide whether or not Augustin should be starting for their team or not on a daily basis.

News:: Diaw registered team-highs in minutes (40), points (19), assists (six), and threes (tied, with two) Saturday at Philadelphia.
Spin:: At the beginning of the season, there was some legitimate concern that Diaw would be ceding time to Tyrus Thomas; however, he's actually averaging slightly more minutes and shots this season than last. Consider him a top-75 player by standard formats.

News:: Henderon (knee) hopes to return to practice within a week or so, the Charlotte Observer reports.
Spin:: Even when Henderson is back to full speed, his minutes will likely hover around the 15-minute mark, making him a non-factor as far as fantasy options go.

News:: Jackson (calf) had a team-high 23 points on 8-of-22 shooting, including 5-of-11 from three-point range, in Tuesday's win over the Nuggets. He added nine rebounds, seven assists, two steals and a block.
Spin:: It wasn't the most efficient shooting performance we've ever seen, but Jackson was the Bobcats' best offensive weapon, and his nine fourth-quarter points proved to be crucial in a 100-98 victory. The best part was that his sore left calf, which kept him out of Tuesday morning's shootaround, didn't seem to give him any trouble.
Status Alert: Jackson (calf) will start Tuesday against Denver, the Associated Press'...

News:: Livingston played close to 28 minutes off the bench against the Bucks and scored a season-high 16 points (5-of-6 FG, 5-of-5 FT). He also put up two assists and two steals in the loss.
Spin:: Livingston has been coming off the bench to be an effective scorer for the Bobcats lately. He has scored in double-figures in four of the last six games. Livingston got plenty of playing time on Saturday after Stephen Jackson, was ejected just five minutes into the game.

News:: McGuire started Wednesday in place of the suspended Stephen Jackson, but had little more than eight rebounds to show for it in Charlotte's loss to New Orleans.
Spin:: McGuire actually had a pretty big night after Jackson got tossed in Charlotte's last game. With Jackson returning for the next contest, McGuire will go back to a reserve role.

News:: Mohammed recorded a nice 14-point, 11-rebound double-double in just 28 minutes of Friday's overtime win over the Nets. He added two blocks in the win.
Spin:: For all of you fantasy owners that have picked up or held onto Mohammed since his 22-point, 20-rebound explosion on November 13 in hopes that he would do it again, this is likely the closest you will see. He has the ability to have decent nights, but will not see the opportunities or playing time to put up huge statistical nights routinely. A double-double every two or three weeks should be the best you can expect if you're a Mohammed owner.

News:: Thomas left Tuesday's game against the Nuggets with left quad tightness and did not return, the Bobcats' official site reports.
Spin:: Thomas was having a strong game before the injury, racking up 16 points (6-8 FG, 4-4 FT) and four rebounds in just 15 minutes. Fortunately for him, Charlotte has the next two days off, so he'll have some extra time to rest before attempting to return Friday at Indiana.
Status Alert: Thomas left Tuesday's game against the Nuggets with left quad tightness...

News:: Wallace played 41 minutes in Tuesday's win over the Nuggets, registering 20 points, nine rebounds, five assists and two steals.
Spin:: Wallace managed just eight points in his last game as he battled an elbow injury, but he appeared to be healthier Tuesday night and should be safe to use going forward.

News:: Arroyo was a perfect 6-for-6 from the field (2-for-2 from three-point range) and 4-for-4 from the free-throw line on his way to 18 points in Monday's win over the Bucks.
Spin:: Arroyo answered with a jumper practically every time the Bucks started to make a run. However, he's still averaging just 7.1 points this season and there's no need to rush out and add him unless he strings together a few good games in a row.

News:: Bosh had 15 points, five rebounds, three assists and a steal in Thursday's win over the Cavaliers.
Spin:: Bosh continues to steadily produce and is now averaging 18.2 points, 7.2 rebounds, 2.4 assists and 1.2 steals over his last five games.

News:: For the fourth time in five games, Chalmers set a season-high in minutes, playing 27 of them Saturday versus Atlanta. In addition to scoring nine points, he also added five rebounds and four assists.
Spin:: With Miami set to play four games next week, Chalmers might be a good end-of-the-bench sort of play next week.

News:: Dampier played 24 minutes off the bench in Monday's win over the Bucks, registering two points, five rebounds and a block.
Spin:: Dampier had played no more than 12 minutes in any of his first five games with Miami. If he starts to play 24 minutes regularly he could carve out some value in deep leagues, but this may have just been a one-game aberration.

News:: Ilgauskas was held scoreless in 17 minutes against the Cavaliers on Thursday.
Spin:: Ilgauskas added some production elsewhere (two rebounds, one assist, one steal and one block), but his biggest moment in this game came during pregame introductions, when he enjoyed rousing applause amidst the deep boos LeBron James and the rest of the Heat received. In very deep leagues, Igauskas can be worth owning, but his six points and five rebounds per game aren't going to improve anytime soon as long as he's only playing between 15-20 minutes a night.

News:: James scored a season-high 38 points on a season-best tying 60 percent shooting from the field (15-for-25 FG) in only 30 minutes of action in a blowout win over the Cavs on Thursday night.  He also added eight assists, five boards, two 3-pointers, a block and a steal in his time on the court.
Spin:: This was James' best game of the season thus far and was a resounding statement in the face of the firestorm surrounding his return to Cleveland.  In fact, there is a possibility that such a huge game under such emotional conditions could help spark James and the Heat out of their slow start to the season.

News:: Jones knocked down five 3-pointers on his way to 18 points (6-for-8 FG, 1-for-2 FT) and six boards in 26 minutes Thursday night against the Cavaliers.
Spin:: Jones has now made at least one three-pointer in five straight games, a stretch in which he has made 15 treys.  The Heat desperately need a consistent long-range shooter to play off of their main players, and if Jones can find the consistency he could hit enough treys to be worth a roster spot.

News:: Heat forward LeBron James said on Saturday that Miller (thumb) was "a week or two away" from returning, ESPN's Mike Wallace reports.
Spin:: This is the most optimistic timetable we've seen for Miller, who the Heat staff have been targeting for a January return. James obviously isn't a part of the team's medical staff, so this news needs to be taken with a grain of salt, but it's still promising to have Miller's teammates think he's close to a return. If Miller is available on your waiver wire, he's worth grabbing and stashing in most formats.
Status Alert: Heat forward LeBron James said on Saturday that Miller (thumb) was "a...

News:: Wade came through with 25 points, 14 rebounds, five assists and a block in the Heat's win Monday.
Spin:: Wade went 9-of-20 from the floor and 7-of-10 from the charity stripe in 39 minutes of action. The 14 boards were a season high.

Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT

News:: Anderson has contracted the illness that has made its rounds in the Magic's locker room, and the team had to put off taking additional MRIs on his sprained right foot as a result, the Magic's official site reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Anderson suffered a mid-foot sprain in Friday's drubbing of the woeful Pistons. He was unlikely to play Monday due to his foot injury, but the illness he contracted has put a double whammy down on any possibility that he'd be able to play. Until the team is able to get MRIs taken of his foot, the severity of the injury will remain unknown.
Status Alert: Anderson has contracted the illness that has made its rounds in the...

News:: Bass capitalized on the absence of an ill Dwight Howard and put up a team-high 27 points (11-12 FG, 5-7 FT) with three rebounds, two assists, and a block off the bench Friday.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Bass' up-and-down role with the Magic has been a point of contention for fantasy players for nights precisely like this one. He can put up great stats when he plays enough minutes, but the Magic like to surround Howard with shooters to spread the floor. Bass will only be a must-play when Howard is out the game, like he was tonight.

News:: Carter stepped up in the absence of his ill teammates and put up 25 points (10-15 FG, 2-5 3Pt, 3-4 FT), four rebounds, nine assists, and three steals in 41 minutes Friday.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Dwight Howard, J.J. Redick, Jameer Nelson, and Mickael Pietrus all missed the game with one illness or another, and Ryan Anderson left the game with a foot injury. Carter is averaging just 29 minutes per game this season, limiting his potential to put up consistently-dominant statistics.

News:: Duhon started at point guard in place of the ill Jameer Nelson on Friday and put up six points, two rebounds, and three assists in 33 minutes.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Duhon was very Duhonsian Friday. Despite playing big minutes, he was unable to produce much in the way of positive statistics. If Jay-Z were asked to describe Duhon's game in one word, he would respond, "Yawn." Nelson could return as early as Saturday.

News:: Gortat started at center in place of an ill Dwight Howard on Friday and put up 14 points (7-9 FG), 11 rebounds, two assists, a steal, and three blocks in 32 minutes.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Gortat should get a second start Saturday with Howard expected to miss a second straight game with an illness. Feel free to grab Gortat for a spot start, but don't forget that his value will dry up when Howard returns.

News:: Howard (stomach virus) had 14 points, 13 rebounds, three blocks, two steals and an assist in Monday's loss to the Hawks.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Howard had missed the previous two games due to a stomach virus that is sweeping through the league, but if he was still under the weather Monday, it certainly didn't affect his performance. He should be safe to use going forward.
Status Alert: Howard will play in Monday's game against the Hawks after missing the...

News:: Lewis (knee) had 15 points, four rebounds and two assists in Friday's win over the Pistons.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: With four key players out due to illness, Lewis played 36 minutes and hoisted 14 shots. Orlando is in a similar situation for Saturday's game against the Bucks and will need Lewis to again shoulder a big offensive load.

News:: Nelson (illness) has been cleared to play during the Magic's upcoming four-game road trip, Dan Savage of the Magic's official site reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Orlando's next game is Thursday at Portland, and it sounds like Nelson will be available for that contest. The stomach virus that felled five different Orlando players is still sweeping through the NBA, but it seems like the Magic are over it for the most part.

News:: An MRI on Orton's left knee showed no major structural damage, the Orlando Sentinel's Josh Robbins reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: There's still no estimate of how much time he will miss, but it doesn't sound like this will be a long-term injury.

News:: Pietrus returned from a stomach virus Monday against the Hawks but was held scoreless in 14 minutes.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: We're willing to give him a free pass on this one since his conditioning is probably still a bit off after missing some time with a nasty illness. He should be healthier for Thursday's game at Portland.

News:: Redick had 11 points, including a three-pointer, to go along with three rebounds and two assists in Monday's loss to the Hawks.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Redick may still be getting back to 100 percent after missing a few days with a nasty stomach virus, but he played fairly well Monday and remains a fantasy option for owners in deep leagues who are looking for three-point shooting help.
