News:: Arenas recorded 14 points (6-13 FG, 2-6 3pt) and six assists in 32 minutes off the bench in Sunday's loss at Phoenix.
Spin:: Arenas' new role is off the bench, but he's still playing 30-plus minutes as a reserve, so the lack of a spot in the starting five isn't as big of a hindrance as you might think.

News:: Armstrong returned from his one-game suspension Friday against Portland. He posted six points, three rebounds, a steal and a block.
Spin:: Armstrong played 12 minutes Friday, which is right in line with his season average. It's hard to produce any kind of fantasy-worthy stats in so little time on the court.
Status Alert: Armstrong has been suspended one game for shoving Joel Anthony on...

News:: Blatche has a left hip contusion and may not play Tuesday against the Lakers, the Washington Post's Michael Lee reports.
Spin:: It sounds like Blatche is going to miss this game, which is strange because there was no news about the injury until roughly 30 minutes before tipoff. We'll consider him questionable for Wednesday's contest at Sacramento until we know more information.
Status Alert: Blatche has a left hip contusion and may not play Tuesday against the...

News:: Booker played well in a career-high 23 minutes Wednesday in a blowout loss at Toronto, recording just five points, but also four rebounds, two steals, and two blocks.
Spin:: With 35 minutes a contest, Booker could be the sort of player to record both a steal and block per game. He's not getting that sort of time with JaVale McGee and Andray Blatche healthy, though.

News:: Hinrich had 15 points and 7-of-12 shooting and five assists in the Wizards' 127-108 loss to the Raptors Wednesday.
Spin:: Hinrich also added one rebound and one assist in in a team-high 34 minutes of action. This was Hinrich' best game in a while and you can't really count on him for consistent fantasy numbers these days, especially with John Wall and Al Thornton returning to the lineup Wednesday.

News:: Howard (knee) might be ready to play as early as Dec. 20, WashingtonWizards.com reports.
Spin:: Howard presumably won't be all that sharp whenever he does return, but he could be valuable in deeper formats when or if he does shake off the rust.
Status Alert: Howard (knee) might be ready to play as early as December 20th,...

News:: Yi returned to the Wizards' lineup in Friday's win over the Trailblazers and played 11 minutes off the bench.
Spin:: Yi only took a single shot attempt, failing to score, but collected three rebounds and two blocks in his limited minutes. He was averaging 22 minutes per game before he sustained a knee injury, but the emergence of JaVale McGee during Yi's absence may see him playing a reduced role going forward.

News:: McGee had a team-high 21 points in the Wizards 127-108 loss to the Raptors Wednesday.
Spin:: McGee shot a robust 8-of-12 from the field and made 5-of-8 from the charity stripe Wednesday. He also added seven rebounds and one assist, but only one block in 27 minutes of action.

News:: Thornton played just 10 minutes off the bench in his second game back from an ankle injury that kept him out for three games.
Spin:: Thornton has only played 25 total minutes through his first two games back in the Wizards' lineup. He'd been averaging 29 minutes per game prior to the injury. It's tough to know what the Wizards' plans are going forward, but a healthy Yi Jianlian and John Wall could be contributing to Thornton's reduced minutes.
Status Alert: Thornton (ankle) will play Wednesday, but he'll be brought off the...

News:: Wall had 22 points, five rebounds and 14 assists during the Wizards' loss Tuesday.
Spin:: Wall went 7-of-14 from the floor and 6-of-6 from the line, also adding one steal and three blocks in 38 minutes of action. Injuries have slowed him some during his rookie season, but Wall clearly is going to have huge fantasy value moving forward.

News:: Young (thigh) scored 20 points (8-14 FG, 2-5 3pt) and grabbed four rebounds in 23 minutes off the bench in Sunday's loss at Phoenix.
Spin:: Young is averaging 15.8 points per game over his last five contests, but this is the only category he usually contributes in statistically.  Don't expect big numbers elsewhere.

News:: Afflalo had a career-high 25 points to go along with two rebounds, two assists, two blocks and one steal during Denver's win over Memphis on Sunday night.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Afflalo has been up and down most of the season but he stepped up huge for Denver on the offensive end Sunday with 11 fourth-quarter points to help seal the club's seventh straight win. The club's starting shooting guard finished 8-of-12 from the field, including 2-of-2 from downtown, and 1-of-2 from the free-throw line.

News:: Tests revealed a small fracture in one of Andersen's lower left vertebra that will keep him out for 10 to 14 days, the Denver Post reports.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Andersen had just returned from his offseason knee surgery when he fell hard in Friday's game and injured his back. He was just starting to get back in a groove too, blocking six shots in Friday's game before suffering the injury. He'll likely be out until the second half of December.
Status Alert: Tests revealed a small fracture in one of Andersen's lower left...

News:: Anthony hit just 4-of-20 field goals during Denver's win over Memphis on Sunday night.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Anthony finished with 13 points, six rebounds and three assists. Outside of the Phoenix game on Nov. 28 in which he played three minutes and finished 1-of-1 from the field, Anthony has not shot 50 percent or better for nine straight games. During that span he's 62-of-173 (35.8%) from the field, including 4-of-20 from 3-point range, and has also shot just 78-of-97 from the foul line (80.4%). We expect he'll come around eventually, as he does have a lifetime 45.8 FG percentage, but he's clearly struggling to find his range at the present time.
Status Alert: Anthony has declared himself a game-time decision for Wednesday's game...

Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN

News:: Billups (wrist) had 16 points on 4-of-10 shooting, including a three-pointer, in Wednesday's win over the Bucks. He added nine assists, two rebounds and a block.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Billups has now played two games since returning from his wrist problem and doesn't seem to be bothered by the injury whatsoever. Even if he continues to take it easy in practice, he should be safe to use.

Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN

News:: Ely, who sat out Denver's previous game because of a fractured tooth, returned to the lineup for Sunday's win over Memphis.
Spin:: Ely had two points, one rebound and one steal in eight minutes of action.

Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN

News:: Harrington had three points, six rebounds, a steal and an assist in Friday's win over the Clippers.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Harrington is averaging just 7.3 points over his last four games, shooting a paltry 28 percent from the field. His combination of rebounding and scoring (including three-pointers) usually makes him worth starting, but there's no question that he's struggling right now.

News:: Nene blew up on Sunday, posting 27 points, 11 rebounds, six assists, two steals and two blocks during Denver's win over Memphis.
Spin:: It was easily Nene's best game of the year, and honestly, one of his best all-around games ever. Based on his past history we'd highly recommend listening to trade offers as Nene is extremely streaky and his value may never be higher than it is right now.

News:: Smith had just five points on 1-of-8 shooting during Denver's nail-biting victory over Memphis on Sunday night.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Smith had scored 20 or more points in three straight games until Sunday. We still think he has some value in deep leagues that value 3-pointers, but outside of that he just isn't seeing enough minutes or doing enough of anything else to justify a fantasy roster spot in shallow formats.

News:: Williams had nine points and nine rebounds in 23 minutes in Sunday's win over Memphis.
Next Game:: Nuggets at CelticsWednesday 12/8, 7:00 PM ET ESPN
Spin:: Williams continues to start at power forward, but rarely is getting more than 20 minutes a night these days. However, there are games when he put some decent numbers.

News:: Beasley (ankle) had 25 points, six rebounds, an assist and a block in Monday's loss to the Knicks.
Spin:: Beasley had missed Minnesota's previous game with an ankle sprain, but he didn't seem to be limited Monday night and should be safe to use going forward.

News:: Brewer scored 15 points with three assists in Saturday's win over Cleveland. He started at shooting guard with Michael Beasley out with a sprained ankle.
Spin:: Brewer has played over 20 minutes in all but two games this season as he's been Minnesota's top option off the bench, but his scoring and shooting has been erratic. He was 6-of-10 from the field on Saturday, which ended an 8-for-25 slump.

News:: Ellington scored 13 points in 26 minutes in Wednesday's loss to Dallas.
Spin:: After losing the starting shooting guard job, Ellington was mostly relegated to the bench in December. However, he's played 12 minutes or more each of the last three games, so it looks like he's getting back into the rotation off the bench.

News:: Flynn (hip) will play Friday and Saturday for Sioux Falls in the D-League, the Minneapolis Star Tribune reports.
Spin:: If all goes well, he'll then make his T-Wolves season debut Dec. 14 against Golden State.

News:: Johnson (stomach virus) scored five points with three assists in 33 minutes in Monday's loss to the Knicks.
Spin:: He shot just 2-of-6 from the field. We assume he'll be back to full strength by Wednesday's game against Oklahoma City.

News:: Love had another big double-double Monday, scoring 33 points while pulling down 15 rebounds during Minnesota's loss.
Spin:: Love made 10-of-18 shots from the field and 10-of-10 attempts from the line, also adding three assists and a steal without committing a single turnover. He's the current favorite to lead the NBA in rebounding this season.

News:: Milicic, who hurt his quad in the first half of Monday's loss to the Knicks, didn't feel well after the game. "A lot of pain," he told the Minneapolis Star Tribune. "Just try and see how it feels tomorrow because I don't want to miss too much."
Spin:: We'll have to see whether he's able to practice Tuesday, but he'll likely be a game-time decision for Wednesday's game against Oklahoma City.
Status Alert: Milicic, who hurt his quad in the first half of Monday's loss to the...

News:: Pekovic (ankle) played for the first time 10 games, recording seven points and seven rebounds Saturday versus Cleveland.
Spin:: The Wolves won by over 30, so it's hard to gauge those numbers; however, it's very unlikely that Pekovic holds any value for the short-term.

News:: An MRI on Tolliver's knee showed a sprained MCL and he'll be out six to eight weeks, the team's official web site reports.
Spin:: At least Tolliver avoided the worst-case scenario, but we'd be conservative and expect him to miss several months.
Status Alert: An MRI on Tolliver's knee showed a sprained MCL and he'll be out six to...

News:: Webster (back) was cleared for game action Tuesday after meeting with doctors and the team's medical staff, the Minneapolis Star Tribune's Jerry Zgoda reports. However, the Timberwolves say they have no projected date for his return.
Spin:: Webster probably won't play Wednesday, but he could be back on the court for the T-Wolves at some point this weekend. Expect his minutes to be limited initially.

News:: The Thunder recalled Aldrich from the D-League on Monday, the Thunder's official site reports.
Spin:: Aldrich averaged 7.8 points, 7.2 rebounds and 1.6 blocks in five starts with Tulsa. With a little game experience under his belt, he'll go back to backing up Nenad Krstic and Serge Ibaka.

News:: Durant finished Monday's loss with 29 points, five rebounds, two steals and two blocks.
Spin:: Durant went 7-of-18 from the field and a perfect 14-of-14 from the line in 33 minutes of run. He's been outplayed by teammate Russell Westbrook early on, but Durant is still clearly one of the best fantasy options around, and no one is a bigger help in the free throw category. Expect the FG percentage to increase from here on out as well.
Status Alert: Durant (knee) will miss Wednesday's game against the Nets according to...

News:: With Kevin Durant (knee) out, Jeff Green took on a prominent role in Wednesday's triple-overtime victory at New Jersey, scoring a career-high 37 points (12-21 FG, 4-5 3Pt, 9-9 FT).
Spin:: Durant was a game-time decision, which means he's likely to play Friday at Toronto. This was a nice game for Green owners, but not necessarily indicative of anything to come for the Thunder power forward.

News:: Harden displayed his offensive prowess Friday in the Thunder's loss to the Raptors. He put up 20 points (5-14 FG, 3-7 3Pt, 7-8 FT), four rebounds and three assists in 30 minutes.
Spin:: Harden was a bigger part of the offense for a second straight game with Kevin Durant missing a another game due to a sore knee. The only things stopping Harden from being a dominant player in the NBA and fantasy are the guys ahead of him on the depth chart. Ride him as long as Durant is out, but know that the return of Durant will mean a reduced role for Harden.

News:: With Kevin Durant making his return from a knee injury, Ibaka will play off the bench against the Warriors on Sunday, the Warriors' official site reports.
Spin:: Ibaka has earned 11 starts this season in place of other injured teammates, and he's come off the bench in the other nine games. As long as Oklahoma City's starters are healthy, Sir Chewblocka will play with the second unit, but he's generally able to be a productive fantasy player even off the bench.

News:: Krstic returned to action Monday after missing two games with back spasms.
Spin:: Krstic totaled three points and seven rebounds in 17 minutes. He'll get more minutes as he gets stronger.

News:: Peterson made his first appearance since Nov. 19, finishing with two points in nine minutes for the Thunder on Friday.
Spin:: With Kevin Durant out, minutes filtered down to the bottom of the roster where Peterson safely resides. He has seen action in just three games this season, playing a total of 16 minutes. Don't expect that to change anytime soon.

News:: Westbrook led the Thunder in points, rebounds, assists, steals, and free-throws made Wednesday night in the team's triple-overtime victory at New Jersey.
Spin:: You could use any numbers of superlatives to describe Westbrook's effort so far this season, but perhaps most important for his fantasy value is his improvement in the free-throw category. Westbrook is converting over four more free throws per game this season than last -- and at a higher rate. That helps him considerably both in free throws and in points-scored.

News:: White, who left Oklahoma City's previous game with an ankle injury, did not play in Sunday's game against Golden State.
Spin:: White was reportedly available for the game, but this may have been a case where coach Scott Brooks was being overly cautious. For much of the game, the Thunder were comfortably ahead, before the Warriors made a fourth-quarter push.

News:: Aldridge had 20 points, six rebounds, one steal and three blocks during Portland's 106-99 win over Phoenix on Tuesday.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Aldridge went 5-of-11 from the field and an impressive 10-of-10 from the line while committing just one turnover. He's averaging a career-high 8.4 rebounds this season.

Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET

News:: Batum will start in place of suspended point guard Andre Miller on Tuesday against the Suns, The Oregonian reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Batum has been productive in his last two games off the bench and has an opportunity for a really strong game as a starter on Tuesday, especially against a Phoenix team that is giving up more points than any other team in the league.

News:: Camby had 12 points and snared 19 rebounds in Sunday's win over the Clippers.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Camby came back with a vengeance after a brutal game Friday night. We question how long his legs will hold up if he keeps playing 38 minutes like he did Sunday, but it looks like he's back on track.

Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET

News:: Marks (ankle) will be active for Wednesday's game against the Celtics, the Blazers' official site reports.
Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET
Spin:: Marks has missed the Blazers' last two games with an ankle injury. He's 35-years-old, and the chances of him getting enough playing time at any point this season are essentially void.

News:: Matthews will not be suspended for leaving the bench area during a scuffle in Sunday's game against the Clippers.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Matthews denied that he went onto the court, and apparently the league agrees. He's on a roll offensively right now and will look to keep things going Tuesday against the Suns.

News:: The NBA has suspended Miller for one game for "making excessive and unnecessary contact with Blake Griffin" in the fourth quarter of Sunday's game against the Clippers, the Associated Press reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Miller will miss Tuesday's game against the Suns. For weekly leagues, you'll only get three games out of Miller this week instead of four, but otherwise this news doesn't have a major impact on his value.
Status Alert: The NBA has suspended Miller for one game for "making excessive and...

News:: Contrary to what he said earlier, coach Nate McMillan said that Nicolas Batum -- not Mills -- will start in place of suspended point guard Andre Miller on Tuesday against Phoenix, The Oregonian reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: So much for Mills having value as a spot starter. He'll be in his usual backup role Tuesday.

Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET

News:: Przybilla will miss Friday's game at Phoenix, and possibly Thursday's game against Orlando, in order to attend his grandmother-in-law's funeral, The Oregonian reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: "She was one of my favorite people in the world," Przybilla said of the woman you may remember from January 2009, when she popped up in the news for threatening to write a letter of protest to commissioner David Stern when the league fined Przybilla for an on-court altercation. Przybilla is expected to return for Sunday's game against the Spurs.
Status Alert: Przybilla will miss Friday's game at Phoenix, and possibly Thursday's...

News:: Roy (knee) will not have any minute restrictions placed on him for Wednesday's game against the Celtics despite it being the second game of a back-to-back set, the Blazers' official site reports.
Next Game:: Magic at Trail BlazersThursday 12/9, 10:30 PM ET TNT
Spin:: Roy has had ominous issues with his knee this season that have limited his production and kept him off the court several nights. His ability to put up numbers across the board when healthy makes it hard to deal him away, but his inability to stay on the court begs that he be traded before a more serious issue arises.

Next Game:: Suns at Trail BlazersTuesday 12/7, 10:00 PM ET

News:: Bell hit four of his five three-point attempts Monday, and finished with 14 points. He also added three rebounds and two assists.
Spin:: Bell has been battling injuries so far this year, but has been having some decent scoring nights lately. He has been an inconsistent shooter, but scored double-figures in four of the last five games. If his minutes continue to increase, he could give fantasy owners a nice scoring boost.

News:: Elson (ear) had four points and a rebound in Friday's loss to the Mavericks.
Spin:: Elson had been bothered by an inner ear problem, but he should be good to go now.

News:: Fesenko suffered a sprained left ankle during the fourth quarter of Monday's win against Memphis, the Salt Lake Tribune reports. He did not practice Tuesday and is doubtful for Wednesday's game against Miami.
Spin:: Fesenko was wearing a heavy protective boot Tuesday and said his ankle has swollen considerably since Monday night. He does not know how much time he might miss.

News:: Jefferson was a solid 11-for-14 from the field to co-lead the Jazz with 22 points in Monday's win. He completed a double-double with 11 rebounds and added four blocks.
Spin:: Jefferson has been pointing together big games more consistently as of late. He has scored over 20 points in four of his last six games, put up three double-doubles in the same period, and has blocked seven shots in the last two games.

News:: Kirilenko scored 18 points (6-15 FG, 5-6 FT) and grabbed seven rebounds in Wednesday's game. He also added two steals and a block.
Spin:: Kirilenko has continues to maintain a steady level of productivity as a starter so far this season, but has not had a blowout game. He has scored in double-figures in every game this season except three, but has yet to score 20 or more. He has also managed to record just one double-double.

News:: Miles hit three three-pointers and scored 20 points in Monday's win against the Grizzlies. He also added three assists, two steals and two blocks to complete a solid stat line.
Spin:: Miles had his best game so far of the month on Monday. It has been more than two weeks since he has scored at least 20 points and was aggressive offensively, taking 14 shots, including seven three-point attempts in the win.

News:: Millsap scored a team-high 21 points (6-10 FG and 9-14 FT) in a home loss to Dallas Friday. He grabbed seven rebounds and added two assists and two blocks.
Spin:: In Friday's game Millsap scored at least 20 points for the first time since mid-November. He has been putting up decent numbers, but the big numbers we have seen from him in the past may not be there so much this year as he has to share the ball on offense with another very good big man in Al Jefferson.

News:: Okur said he's 100-percent healed from his Achilles injury, the Desert News reports.
Spin:: While this is certainly good news, unfortunately Okur still doesn't have a timetable for his return. His comeback seems to be on the horizon, though, so feel free to stash him on your bench if he's available in your league.

News:: Watson hit two three-pointers and scored 12 points in 27 minutes off the bench Monday. He added seven assists, six rebounds, two steals and a block in his best game of the year.
Spin:: Watson has been playing well off the bench lately. He will occasionally give Deron Williams added rest by coming off the bench during the year and he is known to put up big games like the one Monday against the Bucks. Don't expect the same production from him routinely though unless due to an injury in the starting lineup.

News:: Williams had 27 points, four rebounds and eight assists during Utah's win Monday.
Spin:: Williams went 11-of-21 from the field and 4-of-4 from the line, also adding one 3-pointer and one steal. The Jazz improved to 16-6 with the victory.
